pullrequest.title: Slimmed down the Plugin pull request (no more template specializations)

content.raw:
Thanks for the explanation. It sounds reasonable, however there is a benefit to sticking to our style standards for code that we create and distribute. One benefit is consistency across libraries.  Another benefit is that a switch in style is a signal to a user that they are now leaving ignition/gazebo/etc and entering a different library. I'd also prefer not to create a list of exceptions to the already long list of rules. 

The return type of the function should be enough information to a user that they will get a `std::shared_ptr`.
